items.title: A week is a long time in web development
items.content:
âœï¸ Your usual editor, Chris, is currently busy braving the crowds at Disneyland Paris, so I'm stepping into his shoes â€“ just in case you notice a slight difference to the style of this issue ;-) Chris will be back â€“ a little grayer â€“ nextÂ week..Â ğŸ˜…
__
Your other editor, Peter Cooper

ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹633 â€” March 6, 2024 | Read on the web

PixiJS v8: Build Striking 2D WebGL Experiences â€” PixiJS is a very mature, long standing rendering library that abstracts away the pain of building fast 2D graphical experiences for the Web. v8 boasts significant performance improvements, a WebGPU-backed renderer, and a variety of API improvements. If youâ€™re new to Pixi, thereâ€™s an interactiveÂ tutorial.

PixiJS Team

Apple Reverses Course on 'Death' of Progressive Web Apps in EU â€” For the past couple of weeks, weâ€™ve focused on the recent, worrying developments of Apple dropping support for PWAs in iOS as a part of complying with EU regulations, but a week is a long time in the world of Web development, and Apple has â€œreversed course because of numerous requests by consumers to keep the feature.â€ Thatâ€™s one way to putÂ it!

Apple Insider

ğŸ§© Build Your Products 8.6x Faster. Put FrontEnd on Autopilot â€” Customize and theme React templates or drag & drop components coming from top open-source libraries like MUI, Tailwind UI, and more. Need more headstart? Generate UI with AI. When youâ€™re done, just copy the production-ready code off theÂ design.

UXPin Merge sponsor

WebKit Features in Safari 17.4 â€” Just like Safari 15.4 and 16.4, Safari 17.4 is a significant update for developers targeting users across the board, whether on desktop, phones, tablets, or even Vision Pro. CSS Scoping is a big step, there are improvements to white space and text wrapping properties, and we get support for percentages in letter-spacing and word-spacing.

Jen Simmons and Jon Davis (WebKit)

Safari Switching It Up with.. an HTML Switch Control â€” â€œWeâ€™re very excited to introduce a new HTML form control as part of Safari 17.4: a switch.â€ Essentially, it slots in as a more Apple-y variant of aÂ checkbox.

Anne van Kesteren and Jon Davis (WebKit)

âš¡ï¸ Quick Links

  • Long time blogger Jason Kottke has shaken things up with a big '2024 vibes' redesign of his popular blog. You might also enjoy this look at his previous designs stretching back toÂ 1998.

  • Remember when Chris Coyier sold CSS Tricks to Digital Ocean? It turns out he later asked them to give it back to him.

  • Google has made a variety of updates to its search indexing approach to tackle things like expired domain abuse, the generation of large numbers of automated pages, and certain types of third-party content on other sites.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Modern CSS Tooltips and Speech Bubbles â€” Everyone knows what tooltips are, but despite their ubiquity, thereâ€™s no single, universal way to create them. The author of this post presents some modern techniques to create tooltips with the smallest amount of markup while retaining the mostÂ flexibility.

Temani Afif

Playing with Infinity in CSS â€” Did you know CSS has an infinity constant that can be used within calc()? Never lose a z-index battleÂ again!

Will Boyd

Sentry Launch Week: Making Debugging Fun â€” Weâ€™ll be making debugging fun, raffling swag and talking about all things developer, every. single. day. (For oneÂ week.)

Sentry sponsor

'AI' and Accessible Frontend Components: Is the Nuance Generatable? â€” Are LLMs helpful tools to assist with making accessible front-end components? A little bit of yes, but also a lot of no.

Hidde de Vries

Reporting Core Web Vitals with the Performance API â€” The Performance API provides an interface to ways to measure and evaluate Web performance metrics from JavaScript. Geoff demonstrates how to use its features to do your own performanceÂ reporting.

Geoff Graham

Bugs Iâ€™ve Filed on Browsers â€” â€œI think filing bugs on browsers is one of the most useful things a web developer canÂ do.â€

Nolan Lawson

JavaScript Bloat in 2024 â€” Whatâ€™s the average size of JavaScript code downloaded per website? Spoiler alert: itâ€™s a lot and will make anyone from the 56k dialup daysÂ scream.

Nikita Prokopov

Creating a CSS-Only Bottom-Anchored Scrolling Area
Kitty Giraudel

CSS Scroll-Triggered Animations with Style Queries
Ryan Mulligan

CSS for Printing to Paper
Ethan Dalool

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools & Resources

NSFW JS 4.0: Client-Side Indecent Content Checking â€” The last thing most folks want uploaded to their site or app is inappropriate content. NSFW JS is an interesting client-side TensorFlow.js-powered option for detecting potentially improper content before it even reaches yourÂ server. GitHub repo.

Infinite Red, Inc.

Simple Icons: 3000+ Free SVG Icons for Popular Brands â€” This project that we link to every year or two continues to go from strength to strength and is frequently adding newÂ icons.

Simple Icons

Tuple 'Makes Pair Programming with Co-Workers and Friends FunÂ Again' â€” Try Tuple for free and find out why staff engineers at Figma can't stop talking aboutÂ Tuple.

Tuple sponsor

Brainsum's Cookie Consent Bar â€” Few people love them, but cookie consent messages are required in many (though not all!) circumstances and Brainsum says theirs is as compliant as it gets, and can block third party cookies without you needing to refactor your site. Thereâ€™s also some support for Googleâ€™s â€˜Consent modeâ€™. â€“ GitHubÂ repo.

Brainsum

ğŸ©»Â Skeleton Generator: Generate Tailwind-Based 'Loading Skeletons' for HTML Content â€” An online generator that will take your HTML structure and provide animation-based Tailwind equivalents, to display while content isÂ loading.

AE Studio

ğŸ³Â All Country Flags in SVG (Plus CSS for Easier Integration)

Panayiotis Lipiridis

  • TW-Elements 2.0 â€“ 500+ components recreated with Tailwind CSS.

  • melonJS 17.0 â€“ Lightweight HTML5 gameÂ engine.

  • Storybook 8.0.0 RC2 â€“ Frontend component and UIÂ workshop.

  • Color.js 0.5 â€“ Color conversion and manipulationÂ library.
